etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From aceto- + -phenone, after German Acetophenon

definitions: A yellow, sweet-smelling liquid which crystallizes just below room temperature, used in the manufacture of certain synthetic perfumes.

notes.text: Systematic name: 1-phenylethanone; C₆H₅COCH₃. Formerly used as a soporific.
